alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 12 at 9:53PM PST until December 15 at 2:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and strong winds possible. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute on Tuesday. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches above 6000 feet, with localized amounts up to 24 inches, above 7000 ft possible. * WHERE...Mountains above 6000 feet. * WHEN...From late Monday night through late Tuesday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southwest winds of 30 to 40 mph with gusts of 60 to 70 mph, areas of fog, heavy snow, and blowing snow will make travel extremely hazardous to near impossible by Tuesday evening due to low visibility and treacherous road conditions. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains
